item.description:
<p>Level 2 paddle open to Sea Kayaks and Rec Kayaks 10ft or longer which contain bulkheads. We'll paddle the inner harbor on the Seabrook Side and head up the Blackwater River with the tide then return to the put-in around 8pm. For those who want to stay around for dinner we'll have dinner on the Deck at Castaways Restaurant near the put-in. From the North: Take Rte. 95 South to Exit 2 "Exeter/Hampton Route 101". Go through toll, then follow signs for Hampton-Route 101 East. Take this to Hampton Beach. Take a right onto Rte. 1A heading South. Go over the bridge. Parking lot is 1/2 mile down on the right. From the South: Take Rte. 495 North to 95 North. Take Exit 60-Rte. 286 Salisbury Beaches. Follow Rte. 286 East to its end at the beach. At the lights, take a left onto Rte 1A North. Go 1 mile and through the next set of lights. Parking lot is down on the left.</p>
<p>Life vests aka PFDs must be worn at all times when paddling with this group. Also the water is still cold so please wear appropriate cold water protective clothing wet or dry suits recommended.</p>
<p> Click Here for Google Maps Directions: Parking is next to Eastman's Fish Markrt/previously Seacoast Kayak shop</p>
item.how_to_find_us: Look for Kayaks in parking lot
item.name: Seabrook Harbor Paddle
